page.title: 10COMMUNITY
page.content: THERE IS A CONTRAST BETWEEN THE MIDDLE-CLASS DORMITORY AREA OF STANGHOW AND THE ARTISAN TYPE OF RESIDENTS OF THE OTHER SETTLEMENTS. STANGHOW PEOPLE DO NOT SOCIALIZE EXCEPT BY INVITATION WHEREAS IN THE OTHER VILLAGES A STRONG COMMUNITY SPIRIT PREVAILS. PEOPLE WILL HELP EACH OTHER OUT AND ARE VERY INVOLVED IN EACH OTHER'S LIVES AND AFFAIRS. EVERYONE KNOWS EVERYONE ELSE. THE PEOPLE SOCIALIZE BOTH IN ACTIVITIES IN THE VILLAGE HALLS AND THROUGH NEIGHBOURLY EXCHANGES, PARTICULARLY AMONGST THE WOMEN DURING THE DAY. AT CHARLTON THE VILLAGE SHOP AND POST OFFICE ARE SOMETHING OF A FOCAL POINT FOR THE RESIDENTS, AND THE BUSING OF CHILDREN TO SCHOOLS IN BOOSEBECK AND GUISBOROUGH BY CONTRACT BUSES ADDS TO THE FEELING OF COMMUNITY IN THE AREA.
